text: a reader asked well are there any new
medicines available for motion sickness
dr. John Kerry of Johns Hopkins
University often recommends the
scopolamine patch to his patients which
requires a prescription it works by
blocking brain signals that make you
feel queasy it is placed behind the ear
and it slowly releases medication into
the blood which helps minimize side
effects NASA astronauts use the same
medication but because they need a drug
to work at warp speed they take it
orally as a pill even though that
increases risk for side effects and NASA
is currently developing a nasal spray
version of the drug antihistamines also
curb motion sickness there's
dimenhydrinate known as Dramamine and
meclizine known as boning which are
available over-the-counter or there's
phenergan a prescription antihistamine
favored by astronauts in fact it was an
allergist who in 1947 discovered that
Dramamine was an effective medicine for
motion sickness when he used the drug to
treat a patient with hives she was also
cured of chronic motion sickness the
doctor then launched Operation
seasickness he convinced the United
States Army to test the effects of
Dramamine on soldiers sailing to Germany
aboard the general Ballou of the 389
soldiers who took the drug 372 were
completely relieved of motion sickness
but you should know that Dramamine and
boning are known to cause drowsiness dry
mouth and other side effects and of
course this video does not mention every
single drop for motion sickness call
your doctor discuss these and other
medications don't take any drugs without
consulting your doctor and talk to your
doctor before taking any drugs this
warning also applies to astronauts
